active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs between collecting comprehensive endpoint telemetry (e.g., process execution, network connections, file modifications) versus minimizing overhead for performance. Use MITRE ATT&CK to justify which telemetry sources offer the highest detection surface for common TTPs like command-line execution (T1059). Consider real-world impacts on endpoint resources and threat hunting efficacy.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Endpoint Telemetry 003_Collection (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Platforms > 003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle > 003_Collection > Endpoint Telemetry 003_Collection). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to generate a deck of 25 high-quality flashcards. Core Knowledge (Web-grounded, Voter-consensus complete): - Endpoint telemetry: Data from endpoints (process exec/args, network conns, file/registry mods, user logons, sys events) for threat intel/hunting. - Detection surface: Value of sources for MITRE ATT&CK TTPs (e.g., command-line high value for T1059). - IOCs (brittle: hashes/IPs) vs TTPs (robust behaviors). - OpenTelemetry Collector (full): Receivers (ingest: hostmetrics, filelog, journald); Processors (transform: filter, batch, attributes for TTPs); Exporters (output: Splunk HEC, OTLP, Kafka); Extensions (enhance: health_checks, authentication, TLS, remote_config, sampling, load_balancing, proxy). - Data flow: Receivers → Processors → Exporters. - Integrate with threat hunting via ATT&CK mapping. Incorporate: Bloom's progression, concept map dependencies, discussion/peer/problem-solving ties, formative checks. Generate JSON array of flashcards matching EXACT schema: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'references': '...'}, 'metadata': {...}}]. Ensure distractors per protocol, coverage of all layers/objectives, no criminal content.
